xxl.core.io.raw
Class PartitionRawAccess

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.raw.PartitionRawAccess
All Implemented Interfaces:
RawAccess
public class PartitionRawAccess
extends Object
implements RawAccess

Allows user defined partitioning of a raw access. An object of this class represents a consecutive part of a (usually) larger raw access.

Constructor Summary
PartitionRawAccess(RawAccess ra, long startSector, long size)
          Constructs a partition (raw access) inside a raw access.
 
Method Summary
 void close()
          Close the raw access.
 long getNumSectors()
          Returns the size of the partition in sectors.
 int getSectorSize()
          Returns the size of each sector (is the same with the sector size of the base raw access).
 void open(String filename)
          Opens the raw access (the base raw access already has to be open).
 void read(byte[] block, long sector)
          Reads a block from the partition.
 String toString()
          Outputs a String representation of the raw device.
 void write(byte[] block, long sector)
          Writes a block into the partition.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

PartitionRawAccess

public PartitionRawAccess(RawAccess ra,
                          long startSector,
                          long size)
Constructs a partition (raw access) inside a raw access. The partition has the same sector size with the base raw access.

Parameters:
ra - base raw access
startSector - number of the start sector
size - size of the created partition in sectors
Method Detail

public void open(String filename)
          throws RawAccessException
Opens the raw access (the base raw access already has to be open).

Parameters:
filename - name of the file (is not needed here).

                  long sector)
Writes a block into the partition.

Specified by:
write in interface RawAccess
Parameters:
block - byte array of which will be written to the sector
sector - number of the sector in the file/device from where the block will be read
Throws:
